game.ai

Class AI

  • java.lang.Object
    • game.ai.AI
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Brutal, Regular, Sandbox

    public class AI
extends java.lang.Object
    Base AI Class. Only decides ship placement with a placeholder function for shot placement, which is implemented in each individual AI. Also has a placeholder function for updating the User's Ships list, which is implemented only in the Brutal AI.
    Author:
    blackk100

    • Field Summary

      (package private) Ship[] shipsOpp

    • Field Detail

      • gridSelf

        Location[][] gridSelf
        2-Dimensional Location Grid representing the AI's grid

      • gridOpp

        Location[][] gridOpp
        2-Dimensional Location Grid representing the user's grid

      • shipsSelf

        Ship[] shipsSelf
        An array storing the ships of the AI.

      • shipsOpp

        Ship[] shipsOpp
        An array storing the ships of the Player. Only used by the brutal AI.

      • boardSize

        final int boardSize
        An integer show the length of the grid. if initVars[0] is true, boardSize is 15. Else 10.

      • initVars

        boolean[] initVars
        Round Initialization Variables: 
         I-----------I-----------I-----------I
 I Index No. I   false   I    true   I
 I-----------I-----------I-----------I
 I     0     I  10 x 10  I  15 x 15  I
 I-----------I-----------------------I
 I     1     I       Battleship      I
 I     2     I        Cruiser        I
 I     3     I       Destroyer       I
 I     4     I       Corvette        I
 I-----------I-----------------------I

      • fire

        public int[] fire()
        Placeholder function for the AI to fire at the player's ships.
        Returns:
        A 1-Dimensional array storing the X- and Y-Coordinates. 1st Integer is the Y-Coordinate. 2nd Integer is the X-Coordinate

      • place

        private void place(int shipNos)
        Places ships in gridSelf.
        Parameters:
        shipNos - the number of ships present

      • random

        private int[] random(int length)
        (Psuedo-)Randomiser for the place() function
        Parameters:
        length - Length of the Ship
        Returns:
        A 1-Dimensional array storing the X- and Y-Coordinates. 1st Integer is the X-Coordinate. 2nd Integer is the Y-Coordinate
